reviews.review_msg: I feel like he overcomplicated a relatively simple course which made the experience kind of terrible.
GPA killer, easy concepts taught in class but hard exams, he is a hearless prof that doesnt care about our marks. Hope you can find a better prof and good luck everyone

Dr. Pokrishevsky was fantastic, his lectures were very interesting and he was always available outside of class. He was happy to answer all of my questions and was always kind to students. His exams were not too difficult, and the quizzes helped keep me up to date with the material.
Eddie is an awesome lab instructor. He was very engaging and helpful, and the lab exam was straightforward.
Eddie is a great prof. Loved the specimens he would bring to class. His lectures are engaging and he is always willing to help students.
Eddie is excellent. Lectures were very engaging and fun, and the course was very well structures. You can tell he cares about his students.

Prof Pokrishevsky was a great lecturer - he truly cares for his students, and has always found the time to meet with me outside of class and office hours to answer questions. He also made the course quite enjoyable by bringing in various specimens to class and giving us extra resources. Exam were not easy, but fair. A solid choice for BISC300.

I really liked Eddie. He gave good, simple and straightforward explanations to concepts. The labs are pretty self directed which can be a bit confusing at times, but I can't blame that on him. He was very kind and engaging.
Eddie is one of the best profs I have ever had. He made the labs fun, explained the concepts well and was very engaging. He is also very approachable.
BISC300 was a very interesting course, and Eddie was a great teacher. He is passionate, and you can tell that he cares about his students. Lectures were engaging and fun.

i had a bisc102 lab with eddie. all i can say is what a great guy! he really makes hands-on learning extremely fun. 100% this man needs a raise. The TA: Andrew Racks is an out-of-the-park TA and he doesnt include any bs in his TUT's. He gives it raw and straightforward. havent gotten my grade back yet but the final was light so shud be good.

Eddie is just the best. Very clear and ready to help in labs. He's hilarious and easy to get along with. He knew everyone's names very quickly and you could tell he cared about his students and went out of his way to connect with all of us. Our lab exam was very reasonable and I felt well prepared. Would love to have him as a lab instructor again.

I do NOT recommend him to anyone. His lectures are informative, but he goes really fast so it's hard to catch onto the concepts. Whenever I asked him a question, it seemed like he didn't want to answer. He makes you seem dumb for not knowing the answer, then proceeds to give a horrible explanation acting like the answer is already obvious.
Two words: GPA Killer

Very interesting course, and the lecturers were excellent. I was looking forward to attend every lecture. Exams were based on the material learned in class - make sure you study his presentations and focus on the learning objectives.

While the course content was interesting this prof did not seem to care about the low class averages, as he did not scale the final grades. Even the exams and quizzes were quite a mess with confusing wording and that made it quite difficult to correctly answer the questions. Overall, I would not recommend this prof when taking Bisc 300.
He was very knowledgeable and funny in our labs and his feedback was great. My favourite undergrad prof and course.
Dr. Pokrishevsky is an amazing prof. The lectures were clear and he was super helpful.

I enjoyed this class. Dr. Eddie gave us many opportunities to discuss things in class and ask him questions. Gives hints in class about what you should know for the exam and very helpful during office hours. OK load for an MBB class.

Eddie is an involved and genuine prof and he really cares about the success of the class. Lectures were very engaging and exams were fair. I would definitely take more courses with him. As a side note, he is also quite funny
Terrible lectures that involve him just reading off slides posted online but he has 5% iclicker only if you attend more than 80% of lectures
Fantastic prof! Wish I could take more courses with him.

Basically, you can know the lecture slides inside out and still do bad because he expects you to apply your knowledge in really weird ways. His thick accent makes it difficult to understand him and he talks really fast. Tutorials were very irrelevant and a waste of time, but they were mandatory

A fantastic prof. The course covered a lot of material, but he explained everything well and was engaging! The exams were pretty fair and based on the slides and learning objectives. He is quite helpful outside of class. I am looking forward to take another class with him.
One of my favorite profs at SFU. He keeps classes interesting and genuinely wants us to do well. Midterms were fair. I would definitely take more classes with him.
Great prof and engaging classes! Made it very clear what we need to know for the exams. He is approachable outside class, and truly cares about the class and their success.

Class requires a lot of work but Dr. P was wonderful. He is very knowledgeable, caring and passionate about the topics. He gave opportunities to receive extra marks. Exams were fair and based on the learning objectives and study guides.

Eddie wasn't the best. He's very hard to understand in class and basically reads off of slides, so most people never showed up. His midterm and final were fair but were graded too harshly. His 3 take-home assignments are difficult and have nothing to do with the midterm/final. Overall very mediocre - avoid having him if you can!

A nice prof, but sometimes he talks too fast and hard to understand what he is saying. Midterm and final were fair, 3 take home assignments were easy marks. There are weekly quizzes, which helped to keep up with material but overall the course was a lot of work. However, he offers help through emails and you can do a bonus presentation for extra2%
Eddie was one of my favorite first year profs! Interesting topics, engaging lectures and fair exams. Very approachable

Dr. Pokrishevsky was by no means a poor professor. The biggest issue I had with him was simply that, if you missed class, lecture slides were far too complicated in order to catch up on your own and understand what was important. The weekly quizzes were also annoying, especially when taking 5 courses.

Very Nice prof,, but spoke too quiet and fast in class. He was helpful if you emailed or went to him. His lectures were very dense, lots of slides. His assignments were very tough, you had to go to outside sources for help (academic articles). MT was challenging, but the final was much easier & quizzes each wk which were simple. need to put effort

Kind and knowledgeable professor. The class requires a lot of work, but I certainly learned a lot about human genetics and evolution. If too quiet - ask him to turn up the mike, and go to his office hours. Very funny.

Expect amount of assignments you've never seen before in upper division. Asks dull questions that are either specific or just require large amount of work for no reason. Tests don't encourage understanding but rather plain memorization, overall makes the course way harder than it is. Take at your own risk

He's a nice person but does not teach well. He skips through important aspects of lecture. Asks questions we haven't seen before on HW and weekly quizzes. If you have a full course load, STAY AWAY from this class and prof. Makes you work SO HARD for a good grade. Approachable but doesn't clearly answer questions. YOU ARE ON YOUR OWN
Doesn't know how to teach and doesn't teach us what we need to know, but seems like a nice guy. Zooms through the lectures. Don't make the mistake of taking upper division classes with him.

You can tell he cares. However, the lectures are boring. Exams and midterms were fair - sometimes you don't know what topics are more important to study than others. This term, our average ended up being low. Sometimes it is hard to understand him because of his accent.

Exams were fair and straightforward. You could just study off of the slides. However, he wasn't a good lecturer at all and wasn't receptive to students' feedback about his lectures. Also, his lecture slides had too much content and way more info than you needed to know. The only reason to go to lecture is for the iClickers/participation marks

A great prof. Very knowledgeable, wants the students to understand the material, and encourages group discussions during class. The slides were clear and posted after each class. Exams were challenging but fair and have bonus questions  all the material was covered in class. Recommended!

Kind professor, very knowledgeable about topics and has an interest in diseases which he adds to lectures to help you better understand the material. Kind of soft-spoken, even with a mic so don't be afraid to ask him to raise the volume. Exams were fair. Be sure to attend lectures, as he uses iclickers for participation.
